timeline.bodyText: This logic appears to be duplicated from NotificationModuleSubscriber. Please extract it to a common utility function.

nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: Size check is unnecessary when iterating through a list.
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: Can you make each branch here a separate function?
timeline.author: nikklassen
nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: More duplicated logic. Please extract to a helper function.

nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: Don't catch Exception. There are no checked exceptions in this code block

nikklassen

replies.bodyText: removed this condition as it's not required since we're are updating the notification.
replies.author: naveenr-btc

timeline.bodyText: Can you use a more meaningful name than isWorking? This doesn't help me understand what is going on here.
timeline.author: nikklassen
nikklassen
nikklassen

replies.bodyText: we have reserved 1-4 numbers for other type of notifications and so 5 is used for this
replies.author: naveenr-btc

replies.bodyText: Can you make an enum to give readable names to what the notification types mean?
replies.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: The alarm issue was happening because the app was scheduling all the alarm at once. After this fix, the app is going to schedule alarms for a day. The remaining alarm is going to set daily at a specified time with the help of 24 hour repeated alarm. For the repeating alarm, the app is setting an id which is 1. The ids 2,3 and 4 are reserved for future use, in case if we have to create alarm for a different use case. The ids from 5 will be incremented and used to create alarms for activities scheduled with daily, weakly and other types of frequency. Since these are not static value and has to be created dynamically, the option for using enum is ruled out.
replies.author: rohitn-boston

replies.bodyText: It is probably not a good idea to use a single number for so many use cases. However, that's not really in scope here. For now just creating a variable called RECURRING_ALARM_START_ID or something is fine.
replies.author: nikklassen

timeline.message: code review updates for notification classes

timeline.bodyText: Do you know these will be in order? Otherwise this should use max
